intro: Psilocaulon album, commonly known as the white-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Psilocaulon album is often found in disturbed soils and is a common sight in desert environments.
